title: To save the monarchy, Harry and Meghan would be wise to follow the Queen's example
text:
After many years of trundling along gloriously, the monarchy is back under review. The Duke of York is in the soup. The Queen has been dragged into the prorogation row. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are trying to reset their public image with a tour of southern Africa. And 62 per cent of Labour members say Britain should become a republic.

If the rest of us want to keep the monarchy going, we’ve got to keep making the case for it – which is a problem, because that kind of public campaigning is contrary to the whole idea. The monarchy doesn’t justify itself. The Queen is the Queen by grace of God: the moment she defends her position, she implies that she rules by the will of the people, in which...
